text:
Pierrepont Street, north side, near Fulton Street. No. 159 is the frame House with the hip-roof. It was a Cafe known for fifty years as the "Hole in the Wall", and was kept by Dominick Colgan and George Werner, and at a later date by John H. Ham. Also known as "The Assembly" in 1904.

About 1918.?

Eugene L. Armbruster collection.

153-161 Pierrepont Street, north side, west of Fulton Street. The frame home in the center, No. 159, was still standing in (1929).

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
